availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Lewis McConnell (Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Catlettsburg, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Kentucky native. Married to Isabella Henderson McConnell. Father of James H. McConnell and Lucy B. McConnell. Attorney in Greenup County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Catlettsburg in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons (James, Milly, Mary, and Anna) in Catlettsburg in 1860. Judge of Boyd County Court in 1862. Judge of Boyd County Court in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 2, p. 162A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Catlettsburg, p. 801.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, p. 1.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862,” in 1863 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 24. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 304.
Find A Grave, "Charles Lewis McConnell (1825-1906)," Memorial #134439921, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/134439921 (accessed May 22, 2020).
KYR-0002-009-0025.
